intro: Diodia pulchristipula, commonly known as the slender dottle, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Diodia pulchristipula is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
